column2: French: [vilfʁɑ̃ʃ syʁ son] (listen); Francoprovençal: Velafranche) is a commune in the Rhône department in eastern France.

column1: It lies 1 mile (1.6 km) west of the Saône River
column2: and is around 25 kilometres (16 mi) north of Lyon. The inhabitants of the town are called Caladois.
later Jesuit priest Pierre Teilhard de Chardin attended school in the city.

column1: The popular French singers Coralie Clément and Benjamin Biolay
column2: as well as football player hopeful Grégory Bettiol and actor and cellist Maurice Baquet were born in the town.

column1: Villefranche-sur-Saône was founded in 1212 by Guichard IV
column3: and became in the 14th century the capital of the Beaujolais (Francoprovençal: Biôjolês) province. It endured three sieges in the 15th and 16th centuries. The town walls were taken down early in the 19th century.

column1: The church of Notre-Dame des Marais
column2: begun at the end of the 14th and finished in the 16th century
column3: has a tower and spire (rebuilt in 1862)
column4: standing to the right of the 15th century façade
column5: in which are carved wooden doors.

column1: FC Villefranche is based in the town.
The Autoroute du Sud (the principal road from Paris to the south of France) is adjacent to the east of the town
